message.content:
cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.DM 

This paper deals with the problem of constrained hexahedral meshing, which involves the generation of hexahedral meshes that match a given quadrangulation of the topological sphere. This problem is related to computational geometry (cs.CG) and graph theory (cs.GT) as it involves the manipulation of combinatorial structures. The algorithm proposed in the paper also involves backtracking search and the exploration of a tree of sequences, which are techniques commonly used in algorithms for discrete optimization (cs.DS) and numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the paper presents a new upper bound for the number of hexahedra required to mesh a ball-shaped domain bounded by n quadrangles, which is a result in the field of discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
